data.title: "Accessibility Mode On" should not appear in status bar for readonly editors
data.body: @alexandrudima fyi

data.title: GOPATH not recognized when debugging
data.body:
My $GOPATH is set and exported just fine. The go plugin even recognizes the path when viewing the Current GOPATH within the editor; however, as soon as I attempt to debug any go files, there is an error that the GOPATH is not set. Note that the GOROOT is located just fine.

![screenshot from 2016-01-27 23 37 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5186821/12636092/6ddac17c-c54f-11e5-8c3a-a4cd32620324.png)

data.title: SignatureHelp doesn't trigger automatically on nested function call
data.body:
When signature help is open, and you make a nested function call, the original signature help is closed, but the nested call's signature help doesn't get automatically triggered.  Backspace then `(` to re-start the nested call does succesfully trigger the nested signature help.

![sighelperror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/223467/12634370/bd924158-c52d-11e5-95fa-6f91378d4692.gif)

I see this for any `SignatureHelpProvider` implementation, not just TypeScript.

This doesn't seem right.

data.title: Less than operator, <, in for loop breaks some typescript syntax highlighting
data.body:
When writing a class, method names have their own syntax color, but if I use the less than operator, <, in a for loop in a method, all methods after that have their name appear as white instead of their normal syntax color.

[Image of problem](http://postimg.org/image/c4n3y0r1r/)

Edit: Also causes syntax highlighting in other places to also be buggy. (Eg changing the if highlighting to method highlighting)

data.title: sourcemaps + remote debugging issues #2183

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I was trying inlined sources with remote debugging and noticed some issue with sourcemaps. I went back to try out regular sourcemaps with remote debugging and hit issues as well. 

**Basic scenario**
Get the repro from [here](https://gist.github.com/SofianHn/14f261fe62789c6e4453). 

On machine A (MAC)
- cd ~/src/tmp
- tsc
- node --debug app.js

On machine B (Windows)
- cd c:\src\tmp
- tsc
- configure remote debugging 
  "address": (A IP Address),"remoteRoot": "/Users/Sofian/src/tmp", "localRoot": "${workspaceRoot}"

Actual: I am attaching correctly, I am able to debug but that only works for .js not the .ts files. 
Expected: I should be able to debug in my ts source.

**Advanced scenario**
this is even cooler. 

On machine A (MAC)
- change tsconfig by adding `"inlineSources": true`. 
- uncomment debugger from https://gist.github.com/SofianHn/14f261fe62789c6e4453#file-app-ts-L9 
- node --debug app.js 

On machine B (Windows)
- cd c:\src\
- mkdir test
- code . 
- configure the debugger to an attach profile without specifying local and remote root. 

Actual: the debugger connects the sources are streamed, even without having them in the local machine. But when I change the debugger profile to allow sourcemaps, I can't get the debugger to stream the TS sources. 

Expected: It will be super cool if actually the debugger can stream the TS sources. I was able to get it to do this locally by deleting the TS sources without deleting the sourcemaps, it did the right thing by opening a read only TS file. That can be very helpful for debugging live websites. 

Either way, this is really cool :)

data.title: It's not possible to step into the code when not running
data.body: F10 or F11 do not function to step into the code when in the debugger is not running. I think they should step and stop on first line

data.title: Breakoint on first line of a file is skipped
[json] Intellisense Provides Strange Suggestions In Property Value
data.body:
When I'm writing an Azure RM Deployment template and I'm writing a template language expression that contains single-quoted strings inside double-quoted property values, I get some strange suggestions. I get the same thing when I try to access a resourceGroup() property via the '.' character. The pictures show the suggestions I'm getting. In these scenarios, I expect to not get any suggestions.
![jsonintellisenseinpropertyvaluewithperiod](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7052303/12624898/3594dc62-c4e6-11e5-9c01-c79df8076d33.png)
![jsonintellisenseinpropertyvaluewithsinglequotedstring](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7052303/12624899/359895aa-c4e6-11e5-8bd0-d86509483949.png)

data.title: debug console shouldn't show up on every debug launch
data.body: I think it fair for discoverability et to show it on first launch but it always opens itself again which is quite annoying if you are in stage were you don't need it.


data.title: [php] Don't activate auto-completion prompts inside known comment blocks

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Using VSCode 0.10.6 on Windows 7

I've been finding that auto-completion prompts kicks in when I'm writing text in comment blocks and I'm typing the start of some method/variable/symbol that is known by the auto-completion

Attached is example screenshot of some PHP code I'm editing

![vscode_php_unwanted_autocomplete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/563860/12618114/a28917ea-c566-11e5-9aa8-e8c132cde348.png)

data.title: JSDoc does not appear to work for ES6 class ctors
Salsa does not find vanilla JS node modules
file explorer rename reverts change if mouse clicked outside of text box
data.body:
- in VS Code file explorer select 'rename' action on a file or folder
- change the name in the textbox
- with the mouse click outside of the textbox

Observe: the name reverts to the original name.

Problem: this behaviour is very different than the native behaviour.  In the Finder (or Windows Explorer) a click outside of the textbox commits the change.

For a user who is used to click outside of the textbox in order to commit the change, this is really annoying because he will always lose the name change on first try (and has to learn that an explicit "return" is necessary).

I'm suffering from this since the beginning of time of VSCode but only today I found the time to analyse what is going on.

data.title: Salsa cross TS-JS find all references does not work
Salsa: renaming in TypeScript does not rename in JavaScript
allowJs is not in the tsconfig.json schema
data.body: I don't get a suggestion for `allowJs` in `tsconfig.json`.

data.title: Salsa should not suggest "caller" in strict mode as it causes TypeError
Introduce status bar indentation switcher

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I really liked the auto indentation discovery mechanism and not having it sometimes screws the indentation of files that have only tabs.

It would be cool to have a status bar widget that tells me which mode I am on. Even cooler would be to bring back the auto detection as a default and use the widget to communicate its detection.

Clicking it would bring quick open with a picker to switch modes.

data.title: Salsa duplicate literal properties cause should be flagged only when in strict mode
Salsa does not discover properties defined with Object.defineProperty
Salsa does not flag ReferenceErrors in strict mode
data.body:
Testing #2218 

From https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Strict_mode

``` javascript
"use strict";
                       // Assuming a global variable mistypedVariable exists
mistypedVaraible = 17; // this line throws a ReferenceError due to the 
                       // misspelling of variable
```

When I run it with node v0.12.7 I do get a `ReferenceError`:

```
c:\Alex\working_dir\salsa\strict.js:3
mistypedVaraible = 17; // this line throws a ReferenceError due to the
                 ^
ReferenceError: mistypedVaraible is not defined
    at Object.<anonymous> (c:\Alex\working_dir\salsa\strict.js:3:18)
    at Module._compile (module.js:460:26)
    at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:478:10)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Function.Module.runMain (module.js:501:10)
    at startup (node.js:129:16)
    at node.js:814:3
```

I expect Salsa to flag as much as possible of runtime errors, including strict mode reference errors

data.title: Salsa should not place errors on comments
data.body:
Testing #2218 

Interesting squiggly placement strategy:

``` javascript
Number(3).

var x = 3;

// Just_some_good_text_that_did_nothing_wrong
```

![salsa-error-on-comment](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/12615049/b0e51158-c503-11e5-9d47-921eea6c97df.gif)
